com.neovisionaries.animation
Class CompositeInterpolator

java.lang.Object
  com.neovisionaries.animation.InterpolatorBase
      com.neovisionaries.animation.CompositeInterpolator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Interpolator
public class CompositeInterpolator
extends InterpolatorBase

A composite interpolator.

This class combines multiple interpolators.

When doInterpolator() is called, interpolator() method of each registered interpolator is executed one by one and the calculated values are accumulated. The logic of the accumulation is implemented in accumulate() method and the method can be overridden if necessary.

If no interpolator is registered when doInterpolator() is called, CompositeInterpolator behaves in the same way as LinearInterpolator. 


 Interpolator interpolatorA = ......;
 Interpolator interpolatorB = ......;

 CompositeInterpolator ci = new CompositeInterpolator();
 Entry entryA = ci.add(interpolatorA, 1.0F);
 Entry entryB = ci.add(interpolatorB, 0.0F);

 for (int i = 0; i <= 10; ++i)
 {
     // Change weights.
     entryA.setWeight((10 - i) * 0.1F);
     entryB.setWeight(      i  * 0.1F);

     // Use the composite interpolator.
     ......
 }

Author:
Takahiko Kawasaki

doInterpolate in class InterpolatorBase

accumulate

protected void accumulate(float[] value,
                          float weight,
                          float[] output)
Accumulate values calculated by registered interpolators.

The default implementation of this method does the following. 


 for (int i = 0; i < value.length; ++i)
 {
     output[i] += value[i] * weight;
 }

The above implementation assumes that the possible range of each weight is in between 0.0F (no influence rate) and 1.0F (100%) and that the sum of all weights is 1.0F.

Parameters:
value - An interpolated value by an interpolator.
weight - A weight value specified when the interpolator was registered by add(Interpolator, float).
output - The 'output' argument passed to doInterpolate().

add

public CompositeInterpolator.Entry add(Interpolator interpolator,
                                       float weight)
Add a pair of interpolator and weight.

The way that the weight is used depends on the implementation of accumulate() method.

Parameters:
interpolator - An interpolator.
weight - Weight given to the interpolator.
Returns:
An Entry instance that represents the pair of the interpolator and the weight. By using the instance, the weight can be changed after the interpolator was added to this CompositeInterpolator.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - 'interpolator' is null.

getAll

public List<CompositeInterpolator.Entry> getAll()
Get the list of all pairs of interpolator and weight (immutable).

Returns:
A list of all pairs of interpolator and weight. If no pair is registered, an empty list is returned.
